intro: Elaphandra pastazensis, commonly known as the Pastaza elaphandra, is a rare tropical tree native to the Andean region of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds, and it is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
